result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
If this conviction is reversed, set aside, or vacated, you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet other conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).   If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of completing this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarmell Jamez Bingham

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($350) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If this conviction is reversed, set aside, or vacated, you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet other conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).   If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of completing this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 120 days at the House of Correction with 107 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders an uncharged obstruction incident is read-in for sentencing purposes.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received partial discovery and no offer as yet. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Bail argued by counsel.  Court sets bail at $1,000 cash.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Harris has just been appointed on this case and has received a copy of the complaint from the State.  Defense has not received discovery or an offer.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served; original in file.  Case set for bench warrant return on 11-06-15, 8:30 a.m.  PD's office notified by phone.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 350.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham not in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Defense counsel requests time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.   Court reminds defendant to stay clean and not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM026767  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-28-15

Defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Danielle Chojnacki for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jarmell Jamez Bingham in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
